column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2

#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The Last Christmas of Mrs. Claus
#Text=by Alex Wilson
#Text=Betty was thirty - eight and still believed in Santa Claus .
#Text=But sometimes he could be such an asshole .
#Text=She leaned against the kitchen counter , picking dried glaze from the wrinkles in the back of her hand .
#Text=From the wireless headset that dangled from her neck , her old marine buddies called to her with joyous profanity and the bass of digital gunfire .
#Text=The Xbox was upstairs .
#Text=Her buddies were in San Diego and Cleveland .

#Text=Satellite coverage in Santa ’s Village was just another Christmas miracle , like faster - than - light travel and stuffing oneself through gas fireplaces with neither explosions nor lawsuits nipping at your heels .
#Text=It was six o’clock .
#Text=Santa had said he needed to leave at eight .
#Text=So Betty had made Christmas Eve dinner while listening to — instead of participating in — the big special ops campaign game online .
#Text=She ’d garlic - salted the yams to the tune of Gomez unloading his Glock into a drug dealer .
#Text=She ’d painted the ham with maple glaze while Williams punctuated Patty Smyth ’s “ Goodbye to You ” with bursts from his assault rifle .
#Text=“ Her boys , ” as she called them , did n’t take a lot of eggnog in their rum .
#Text=Santa had spent his day opening envelopes from North American children and falling asleep watching the Pittsburgh - Cleveland game in the media room .

#Text=Now he was in the kitchen , awake and on his way out the door , because suddenly spending fifteen minutes eating dinner with his wife had become too much of a burden on this most wonderful night of the year .
#Text=His white V - neck undershirt was tucked into his pants in front , pulled taught over his belly .
#Text=It stretched the neckhole halfway down to his happy trail .
#Text=His hands were finding their way through the armholes of his robe .
#Text=“ It ’s just that there are more children in the world now , ” he said .
#Text=“ And Santa ’s not getting any younger , ho ho ho . ”
#Text=“ Do n’t get much older either , ” Betty said .
#Text=Santa ’s first wife had died centuries ago , but he always just dismissed the question of his own mortality .
#Text=Betty never knew how naughty she should feel about wanting to strangle him sometimes .
#Text=“ You ’re seriously going to let me eat alone again on Christmas Eve ? ”
#Text=“ Do n’t think of it like that , doll , ” Santa said .
#Text=“ Think of the children . ”
#Text=He slung his belt around his back , and gave it a quick tug .
#Text=His waist shrunk from dangerously obese to barely jolly .
#Text=A few crumpled bills in American currency fell out of his pocket .
#Text=Santa bent down to pick them up , mumbling about “ emergency money . ”
#Text=“ Ca n’t you get dressed in the bedroom like a normal person ? ” Betty asked .
#Text=Distorted shouting erupted from Betty ’s headset .
#Text=She imagined red and yellow mosaic bursts lighting up the sunless snowscape outside , as if there was an HDTV behind the blinds instead of their kitchen window .
#Text=One of her boys probably stepped on a landmine .
#Text=Williams , she guessed .
#Text=She thought she could hear Gomez laughing .
#Text=She picked up the pans in which she ’d made the potatoes and maple glaze .
#Text=She put them in the sink to soak .
#Text=The gingerbread batter bowl could wait a day , even though it would take longer to clean tomorrow .
#Text=For now , she appreciated its fight to cover the ham - stink that coated the room .
#Text=The jingle bell chimed on Santa ’s cell .
#Text=“ Nutcrackers , ” he said .
#Text=“ Santa ca n’t reach it , and it ’s probably Ginny .
#Text=Would you be a doll ? ”
#Text=“ Your secretary ’s calling , and you need me to answer it ?
#Text=How efficient . ”
#Text=Betty wiped her fingers on a hand - towel .
#Text=She lifted her headset ’s microphone to her mouth .
#Text=“ Moroz out .
#Text=Back in five . ”
#Text=“ Copy that , ” Gomez said on the other end .
#Text=“ It ’ll take that long to put Humpty back together again anyway . ”
#Text=Betty switched off her headset mic .
#Text=She unclipped the cell phone from the back of Santa ’s girdle , and pushed the button with the green arrow , serrated to look like a double - edged diving knife .
#Text=Or a Christmas tree , if that was more your thing .
#Text=“ Hey Ginny , ” Betty said into the phone .
#Text=“ Oh hello , Mrs. Claus , ” Ginny said .
#Text=“ Merry Christmas . ”
#Text=“ For heaven ’s sake , call me Betty . ”
#Text=“ Sorry , Mrs. Claus .
#Text=Has Mr. Claus left yet ? ”
#Text=“ On his way , ” Betty said .
#Text=“ He was just thinking of the children .
#Text=One at a time .
#Text=He ’s very thorough . ”
#Text=“ How wonderful ! ”
#Text=Get an extra and subtract it . Calculate two minus fives and threeminus one . Calculate three times x than y.
